question: Find the value of 0.64 ÷ 20. Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places.
Mr Tan drove from Singapore to Malacca at 21:50. He reached Malacca at 02:00 the next day. How long did he take to reach Malacca?
In a stadium, 1/3 of the spectators are males. What is the ratio of the number of female spectators to the number of male spectators in the stadium?
Simplify 17 + 9a - 8 - 3a. Write your answer in the simplest form.
What number must be added to 907 100 to give a million?
Carol mixed 1/4 L of water with 1/3 L of syrup to make some fruit punch. How much fruit punch did Carol make? Give your answer as a fraction.
A rectangular container has a base area of 90 cm². It holds 270 cm³ of water when it is 1/3 filled. What is the height of the container?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 30 cm. What is the greatest possible area of the rectangle?
Martin bought 3 identical red shirts and 5 identical blue shirts. The total cost of the shirts was $186. Each blue shirt costs $4.40 more than each red shirt. What is the cost of one red shirt?
A pen costs 95¢ more than a pencil. Catherine bought twice as many pencils as pens. She spent a total of $53.60. She spent $2.40 more on the pens than the pencils. How many pens did Catherine buy?
Rosia paid $18 using only 20-cent and 50-cent coins. She used half as many 50-cent coins as 20-cent coins. How many 20-cent coins did she use?
The ratio of Anthony's stickers to Ben's stickers is 4:5. The ratio of Anthony's stickers to Charles' stickers is 8:7. Find the ratio of Charles' stickers to Ben's stickers to Anthony's stickers.
Which of the following, when rounded off to the nearest thousand is 853 000?
Last year, Mr Lim's monthly salary was $1000. This year, his monthly salary increases by 12%. What is Mr Lim's monthly salary this year?
A wheel of radius 8 cm has turned 25 revolutions. What is the distance the wheel has travelled in terms of π?
The mass of Parcel A is 9 kg. The total mass of Parcel B and Parcel C is 24 kg. What is the average mass of the 3 parcels?
Meredith used 108.06 g of flour to make 6 similar cupcakes. How much flour would she need to make 9 such cupcakes?
Find the value of 6 ÷ 2/7
Find the value of 0.609 × 80
Jane is standing in a queue. She is the 4th person from the front and the 17th person from the back. How many people are there in the queue?
The total height of 4 children is 546 cm. One of the children is 150 cm tall. What is the average height of the other 3 children?
There are 40 members in a sailing club. There are 8 more male members than female members. What percentage of the members are female?
Cupcakes Promotion: All cupcakes at $2 each. Buy 8 and get 1 free! Janie paid $80 for some cupcakes. How many cupcakes did she get?
After Alice gave $8 to Bobby, the ratio of the amount of money she had to the amount Bobby had became 1:4. If they had $40 altogether at first, how much money did Alice have at first?

A van left Town A for Town B at 10:00 and travelled at an average speed of 55 km/h. At 13:00, a car left Town A for Town B. If the car took 2 h to catch up with the van, find the average speed of the car.
The number of boys is 3/4 of the number of men. There are 112 more women than girls. If there are 224 adults in the hall and 160 of them are women, how many people are there in the hall altogether?
Which one of the following has the same value as 5²?

Cheryl and Kenny shared some marbles. Cheryl had 2/3 the number of marbles Kenny had. What was the ratio of the number of marbles Cheryl had to the number of marbles Kenny had to the total number of marbles they had?
The distance around a running track is 400 m. Ali took 10 minutes to walk around the running track twice. What was Ali's average walking speed?
A square garden has a side length of 14 cm. A circular pond of radius 7 cm is in the center. Find the area of the grass around the pond. (Take π = 22/7).
Mrs Lee had 1/2 kg of sugar. She bought another 1/4 kg of sugar. She packed all the sugar equally into bags of 1/8 kg each. How many bags of sugar did she have?
A rectangular tank was half-filled with water. When 4.5 L of water was added, it became 3/4 full. What was the height of the tank if its base area was 500 cm²?
Isabelle ate 1/4 of a pie. She cut the remainder into 4 equal slices. What fraction of the pie was each slice?
Mrs Ang packs 6 kg of flour into smaller packets. Each smaller packet contains 900 g of flour. How much flour is left unpacked?
Sam scored 8, 12, 11, 9 and 10 points from January to May respectively. How many months did he score at least 10 points?
Sam scored 8, 12, 11, 9 and 10 points from January to May respectively. What was his average score per month?
After receiving a discount of 20%, Mrs Tan paid $56 for a watch. What was the price of the watch before the discount?
The base area of a rectangular tank is 20 m². The tank contains 120 m³ of water when it is 3/4 filled. What is the height of the tank?
A large rectangle is divided into three identical smaller rectangles arranged side by side. The first and third rectangles are shaded. What is the ratio of the total shaded area to the unshaded area?
Gabriel's mass is 8 times Helen's mass. Express Helen's mass as a fraction of their total mass.
May started the game with 200 marbles and lost 60 of them. What percentage of her marbles did she lose?
Which of the following is the same as 8 070 ml?
The total length of stick A and stick B is 9 m. Together with stick C, the average length of the three sticks is 6 m. What is the length of stick C?
Sarah has some mystery and comic books. The number of mystery books is 3/2 the number of comic books. What is the ratio of the number of mystery books to the total number of books she has?
Peter is n years old now. His sister is 3 times as old as he. What will their total age be in 5 years' time?
Kevin cut a ribbon measuring 274.6 m into 20 equal pieces. What is the length of each piece of ribbon? Give your answer correct to 1 decimal place.
The circumference of a coin is 7.85 cm. (Take π = 3.14.) What is its diameter, correct to 1 decimal place?

At the zoo, the Elephant, Giraffe, Tiger and Zebra enclosures lie to the north, east, south and west of the viewing deck respectively. Ahmad started facing the Elephant enclosure. He turned 180° clockwise, then another 90° to his left. Which enclosure is he facing now?
Simplify 13h + 5 - 4h × 3.
Joo has thrice as many stamps as Koon. If Joo has 36 stamps, How many stamps do Joo and Koon have altogether?
A wheel has a radius of 21 cm. What distance does it cover after 10 revolutions? (Take π = 22/7.)
What is the value of 15 × 5?
Jerry and Cindy share $(3x − 5). Jerry gets $x more than Cindy. How much does Cindy get if x = 6?
A piece of wire 32 cm long is bent to form a square. What is the area of the square?
In which one of the following numbers does the digit 8 have the largest value?
To make a fruit salad, Mdm Norah needed to buy the same number of apples and oranges. Apples: 6 for $2, Oranges: 4 for $3. What was the least amount she could have spent?
What is the difference between 13 tens and 13 tenths?
A basin was 1/4 filled with water. After adding 450 ml of water, it became half full. How much water was there in the basin at first?
A motorist travelled at 60 km/h for the first 3 h. Then he travelled at 90 km/h for another 2 h. What was the total distance he travelled?
What is the value of 800 x 30?
Sue started her piano lesson at 2.40 p.m. and ended her lesson at 4.05 p.m. How long was her piano lesson in hours and minutes?
What is the value of 12.16 ÷ 4?
Which of the following lines is perpendicular to y = 2x?
The radius of a circle is 28 cm. Find its circumference. (Take π = 22/7)
Find the value of 6 ÷ 3.
Dave read 3/4 of a book last week. He read the remaining 108 pages this week. How many pages did Dave read altogether?
Ali paid $51 for 6 concert tickets. How much must he pay for 10 concert tickets?
Which fraction is greater than 3/5 but less than 4/5?
The length of a cube is 9 cm. What is the volume of the cube?
MAGIC SHOW tickets cost $20 each with a $3 discount for every 4 tickets bought in one receipt. Jacqueline is buying 6 tickets for the show. How much does she need to pay?
Gary saves $320 of his salary each month and spends the rest. In December, he spent an additional 4% of his salary, so his savings dropped to $240. How much is his salary?
What is the value of 15 × 4?
There were 950 visitors at an art exhibition on Saturday. The number of visitors increased by 20% on Sunday. Find the number of visitors at the art exhibition on Sunday.

Mrs Goh had some $2 notes and some $10 notes. She had 95 notes altogether. When she exchanged all the $10 notes for $2 notes, she found that she had 175 notes. How many $2 notes did she have at first?
Olivia and Nelly shared the cost of a present. The present cost $270 and Olivia paid $90 more than Nelly. How much did Olivia pay?
At 10:30 a.m., both Brian and Alex passed a post office that was 150 km from Town Q. Brian continued at 75 km/h while Alex travelled at 60 km/h. At what time did Brian reach Town Q?
What number should replace the box in the equation 6 × □ = 48?
A tank was completely full. After removing 210 ml of water it became 4/5 full. What is the capacity of the tank?
An examination lasted 105 minutes and ended at 11:00 a.m. What time did it start?
The radius of a wheel is 14 cm. What distance will it cover if it makes 10 turns? (Take π = 22/7.)
There were 650 people at a carnival. Sixty percent were adults and the rest were children. How many children were there?
Which of the following shapes can tessellate a floor without gaps or overlaps?
What is the missing number in the box? 8 ÷ 4 = ?
Find the value of 0.2 × 90.
Sonia had 26 clips while Grace had 14 clips. How many clips must Sonia give to Grace so that they have the same number of clips?
A rectangular tank is 3/4 filled with water. If another 160 litres of water is needed to fill the container to its brim, what is the capacity of the tank?
A bag contained 1.92 kg of flour. It was packed equally into 8 small packets of 0.2 kg each. How much flour was left?
Joy spent 20% of her money while Ken spent 25% of his money. If they spent the same amount of money, what is the ratio of Joy's money to Ken's money? (Express your answer in its simplest form)
A number, when divided by 6, gives a quotient of 13 and a remainder of 4. What is this number?
Mr Tan started painting his house at 8.15 a.m. He spent 3.5 h painting before lunch. He took an hour's lunch break and spent another 2.5 h painting after lunch. At what time did he stop painting?
A sequence starts with 4 and increases by 4 each time (4, 8, 12, ...). What is the value of the 100th number of this sequence?
What is the value of the digit 7 in 419.675?
The Singapore flag has a length-to-breadth ratio of about 3:2. Which of the following ratios best represents this?
Which of the following numbers has the greatest value?
Which of the following number is the largest common factor of 6 and 12?
Find the value of 3/4 − 2/5.
Find the value of 2763 ÷ 9.
Mrs Siti has 210 red, blue and yellow buttons. The ratio of red buttons to blue buttons is 2:3, and the ratio of blue buttons to yellow buttons is 4:5. How many yellow buttons does Mrs Siti have?
Ali bought 64 stamps. He gave away 12 of them, then received 20 more. He shared all his stamps equally into 8 small boxes. How many stamps were in each box?
The ratio of Steven's age to Cindy's age is 3:2. The ratio of Richard's age to Cindy's age is 2:5. If Steven is 33 years older than Richard, what is the total age of the three people?
A box filled with sand weighs 10 kg. After removing 3/4 of the sand, the box and remaining sand weigh 4 kg. What is the mass of the empty box?
The average of 6 numbers is 55. When a 7th number is added, the average of the 7 numbers becomes 64. What is the 7th number?

Sui Leng has some 20-cent coins and 50-cent coins. She has 6 more 50-cent coins than 20-cent coins. The value of the 50-cent coins is $9 more than the value of the 20-cent coins. How many coins does she have altogether?

Vivian spent 25% of her money and additional $45 on a bracelet. She then spent 40% of her remaining money and an additional $25 on a watch. Given that she was left with $65, how much money did Vivian have at first?
A bag cost $150 before a 20% discount. How much did Kimberly pay after the discount?
A circle has a radius of 14 cm. What is its area? (Take π = 22/7.)
Vignesh turned 135° clockwise and is now facing North. Which direction was he facing before he made the turn?
Alicia has $200. This is $50 more than her sister has. How much money do they have altogether?
Find the value of 16 ÷ 4.
Evaluate 100 - 11 × 8 ÷ 4.
A cube has an edge length of 7 cm. What is its volume?
A butter cake recipe requires 250 g of butter to make one cake. How much butter must Daisy buy if she wants to make 5 such butter cakes?
Mr Wee has a sack of flour. He sold 40% of it and repacked the rest into 8 small packets. What percentage of the sack of flour is each small packet of flour?
Find the value of 8a - 15 when a = 5.
A group of 5 boys booked a badminton court for 2 hours and took turns to play. At any time, there were 4 boys playing badminton. On average, how long did each boy play?
Rectangle ADG has an area of 32 cm² and a width of 4 cm. Another rectangle, BCEF, shares the same width but has a length of 12 cm. What is the area of rectangle BCEF?
A shop sold 480 oranges in January and 440 oranges in February. Sales decreased by 40 oranges each month. How many oranges were sold in March?
Squares WXEF and XEFZ each have side length 6 m and share the side EF, forming a single 6 m by 12 m rectangular fence wall. What is the perimeter of this fence wall?
Find the value of 3 + 7.
The ratio of cars to vans in a carpark is 16:12. The ratio of vans to motorcycles is 1:2. What fraction of the total number of vehicles are cars?

The number of pupils in four CCAs is shown below. Basketball: 12 girls and 18 boys. Football: 10 girls and 25 boys. Swimming: 14 girls and 21 boys. Badminton: 16 girls and 20 boys. In which CCA is the ratio of girls to boys equal to 2:3?
The ratio of Nancy's age to Mandy's age now is 5:1. In 12 years' time, the ratio of Nancy's age and Mandy's age will be 3:1. How old is Nancy now?
Darren jogged around a 400-m running track. He completed 4 rounds of the same track in 8 minutes. What was his average speed in m/min?
The mass of a box with 20 identical books was 17.8 kg. The mass of the same box with 12 books was 11.12 kg. What was the mass of the empty box?
A bakery sold 3/4 of its muffins and had 45 muffins left. How many muffins were baked at first?
A 16 cm by 16 cm square has two opposite corners cut out in the shape of quarter circles of radius 8 cm. What is the total area of the two quarter circles? (Take π = 3.14)
In the number 103.75, which digit is in the tenths place?
Point A lies 3/7 of the way from 84 to 105 on a number line. What number does point A represent?
Which of the following is the most reasonable mass of an adult human?
Which fraction is smaller than 3/10?
There were 70 girls and 80 boys in a hall. Twelve girls and eighteen boys wore glasses. What percentage of the children wore glasses?
Guo Hua's average score for English, Math, Science and Chinese was 28. He scored 24 for English and 22 for Chinese. What is the sum of his Math and Science scores?
Mrs Lee bought w cups of bubble tea at $5 each. She gave thé cashier $50 and used the remaining money to buy 3 donuts. What: was the cost of each donut in terms of w?

Square ABCD is made up of four equal smaller squares arranged in a 2-by-2 grid. Each small square has a side of 4 cm. If the two squares on the main diagonal are shaded, what is the total shaded area?
A rectangular tank measuring 10 cm by 8 cm by 6 cm holds 480 cm³ of water. When the water is poured into another container, 120 cm³ spills over. What is the capacity of the container?
Simplify 8n + 9 - 3n - 5.
A train travels 240 km in 3 hours. It then travels another 180 km in 2 hours. What is the average speed of the train for the entire journey?
Muthu bought some red and purple balloons. For every 1 red balloon bought, he bought 7 purple balloons. Muthu bought a total of 56 balloons. How many red balloons did he buy?
50 children were at camp. There were 18 girls. What percentage of the children were boys?
Ken had 170 more stamps than Luke at first. Ken gave 37 stamps to Luke. How many more stamps did Ken have than Luke in the end?
Find the value of 7.07 + 5.

Mrs Lim wants to give some biscuits to her pupils. If each pupil receives 4 biscuits, she will have 39 biscuits left. If each pupil receives 5 biscuits, she will need 6 more biscuits. How many pupils are there?
In February, the average temperature increased by 2°C as compared to January. This was a 10% increase. What was the average temperature in February?
On a number line, point X represents 1/5 and point Z represents 1. Point Y lies midway between X and Z. What fraction does Y represent?
Colina had 1962 cookies. She packed them into bags of 30 cookies each. How many cookies were left unpacked?
Mindy and Nathan have $274 altogether. Mindy has $15 more than Nathan. How much money does Nathan have?
Mrs Henderson bought 2 kg of flour. She gave 1/4 of the flour to her neighbour and used 1/2 kg of the flour to bake a cake. How much flour did she have left?
Each file costs $2 and a book costs as much as 8 files. Mrs Koh bought 5 books and 12 files. How much did she spend altogether?
On Monday, Awesome Bakery sold 20 chocolate cookies, 15 butter cookies and 15 peanut cookies. Each cookie cost $2. How much money did the bakery collect?
A clinic opens from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and from 1:30 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. every Wednesday. How long is the clinic open on Wednesdays?
Find the value of 3n + 4 when n = 6.
The number of visitors to an amusement park was 4200 in June. This was a 20% increase from the number of visitors in May. How many visitors were there in May?
A machine prints 350 pieces of paper in 27 minutes. At this rate, how long does the machine take to print 150 pieces of paper?
The table shows the rental charges for a car. First 3 hours cost $150. Every additional hour costs $20. Mrs Chua paid $290 for renting a car. How many hours did she rent the car for?
Eric started cycling at 25 km/h from his house to the swimming complex. The swimming complex is 10 km away from his house. How long did he take to reach the swimming complex?
Francis baked thrice as many muffins as tarts. After giving away 67 muffins and 43 tarts, Francis had equal number of muffins and tarts. How many tarts did Francis bake?
Michelle spent $6 more than Nicole. They spent $m in total. How much did Michelle spend?
Three 3-digit whole numbers have an average of 180. One of the numbers is 180. What is the largest possible difference between the other two numbers?
Wayne drove a car for one hour for the first 75 km of a journey. He completed the remaining 45 km of the journey in half an hour. What was Wayne's average speed for the whole journey?
Which fraction is equivalent to 3/5?
A solid is built from unit cubes with a 3-by-2 layer at the bottom and a 2-by-2 layer placed centrally on top. How many unit cubes are used in total?
Tara had 2 m of string. She cut as many pieces of 3/4 m as possible. How much string was left over?
A semicircular garden has a radius of 7 m. A fence is built along the curved edge and along the straight diameter. Find the total length of fencing needed. (Take π = 22/7.)
A rectangular garden has a length that is 3 times its width. The perimeter of the garden is 48 meters. What is the area of the garden in square meters?
Rayden spent $120, $150, $90, $130 and $110 from March to July respectively. What was his average monthly spending over those five months?

The table shows the time taken by 5 students to complete their homework. Student A: 30 minutes, Student B: 45 minutes, Student C: 60 minutes, Student D: 40 minutes, Student E: 50 minutes. What was the average time taken by the 5 students to complete their homework?
The ratio of Abdul's money to Josephine's money is 4:5. What is the ratio of Abdul's money to Josephine's money after Josephine spends 1/5 of her money?
Katelyn's average score in four tests is 76. She scored 70 for her first test and the same score for the remaining three tests. What is the score for each of the remaining three tests?
What is the numeral for five million, fifty-five thousand, five hundred and five?
In triangle ABC, the perpendicular height from A to base BC is 9 cm. If the area of the triangle is 54 cm², what is the length of BC?
A strip consists of four equal squares stacked vertically. The top two squares are shaded. How many additional squares must be shaded so that the pattern has symmetry about the midpoint of the strip?
Mrs Chen bought a cake. She ate 1/4 of it and her sister ate 1/5 of it. What fraction of the cake was left?
Leroy and Devina shared $260 in the ratio 3:2. How much money did Leroy receive?
At a carnival, 60% of the visitors were adults and the rest were children. Among the children, the ratio of boys to girls was 2:1. What is the ratio of the number of boys to the number of adults?
Mr Toh prepared 3 litres of lemonade. After drinking 250 ml, he poured the rest equally into 5 bottles. How much lemonade was in each bottle? Give your answer in litres.
Find the value of 6 - 30 + 6 × (9 + 3).
Joshua started fixing a puzzle at 19:25. He completed the puzzle in 45 minutes. What time did Joshua complete the puzzle?
Terry watched a movie which started at 11:45 a.m. The movie lasted 128 minutes. What time did the movie end?
Anna, Ben, Cara and Dan scored 12, 18, 15 and 15 points respectively in a game. What was their average score?
Mrs Rahman had 1 kg 500 g of flour. She bought another 3.008 kg of flour. She used 1.08 kg of flour for baking. How much flour had she left in the end?
A rectangle measures 10 cm by 8 cm. A smaller rectangle measuring 4 cm by 3 cm is cut from one corner. What is the area of the remaining figure?

Kovi has some toy cars. If he shares them with 2 or 3 friends, there will be no toy cars left. If he shares them with 4 friends, there will be 1 toy car left. What is the least possible number of toy cars he could have?
What is the value of 16 × 5?
1/3 of Siti's savings is the same as 1/3 of Peter's savings. What is the ratio of Siti's savings to Peter's savings?
The average height of Jodie, Ken and Larry is 108 cm. Jodie is 138 cm tall. Ken is 97 cm tall. How tall is Larry?

Fiction books cost $8 each and non-fiction books cost $12 each. Mei bought more fiction books than non-fiction books. If she bought 5 non-fiction books and the total cost of the non-fiction books was $12 more than the total cost of the fiction books, how many fiction books did she buy?
Each circular ornament in a display requires 5 identical sticks. If 505 sticks were used, how many ornaments were made?
James spent all his money on 6 cupcakes and 14 tarts. If he had bought 4 cupcakes and 2 tarts, he would save $3.60. Each cupcake cost $1.20 more than each tart. What was the cost of 1 tart?
How many sixths are there in 5 1/3?
The number of boys is 5/6 of the number of pupils. Find the ratio of the number of boys to the number of girls.
Solve 2x + 10 = 34.
Jason has 12 kg of salt. He packs them equally into 6000 packets. What is the mass of 1 packet of salt?
The diagram shows 3 containers with water. Container A has 200 ml, Container B has 300 ml, and Container C has 200 ml. What is the total amount of water in all 3 containers?
Find the value of 60 + (15 - 3 + 3) × 9.
A figure is divided into 8 equal parts. 3 parts are shaded. What fraction of the figure is shaded?
Mrs Ramesh bought a packet of sweets for $2.95. How much did she pay for 40 packets?
A rectangular garden has a length that is 2/3 of its width. The perimeter of the garden is 70 meters. Find the area of the garden in square meters.
There were 160 pupils in a drama club last year. This year, there are 120 pupils in the same club. What is the percentage decrease in the number of pupils who join the drama club this year?
Mrs Koh bought 90 tarts and repacked them into boxes of 6. How many more tarts would she need to buy to fill up the last box completely?
Starting on a Monday, Ken saved some money every day. He increased his savings by 20 cents each day until Thursday. He saved a total of $6 by the end of the four days. How much did he save on Monday?
Mdm Ling poured 2 litres of juice into bottles that each hold 250 ml. How many full bottles could she fill?
There are 28 blue marbles and 52 red marbles in a box. What is the ratio of blue marbles to red marbles in simplest form?
Simplify 5w + 6 - 2w + 11 - 9 - w.

A square garden has a side of 8 m. Two identical 8 m by 2 m rectangular paths are attached to the left and right sides of the square. If only the square is shaded, what is the total area of the unshaded rectangular paths?
Abdul baked a pizza and ate 1/4 of it. He gave 1/3 of the remainder to his sister. What fraction of the whole pizza was left?
Eliza ate 1/4 of a pizza and 3 friends shared the remaining pizza equally. What fraction of the pizza did each of her friends receive?
Every 400 m or part thereof costs 28 cents. Jenny took a taxi to her aunty's house which was 4.8 km away. How much is her taxi fare?
Mr Tan had 460 stamps. 20% of the stamps are Singapore stamps. He then bought more Singapore stamps and his collection of Singapore stamps increased to 60%. How many Singapore stamps did he buy?
A shopkeeper bought 255 apples and 50 oranges. He sold 1/3 of the apples and 1/2 of the oranges. How many fruits did he sell altogether?
Find the value of 1/2 + 1/3
What is the value of 20 - 3x + 2 when x = 4?
The diameter of the semi-circle below, not drawn to scale, is 28 cm. Find the perimeter of the semi-circle. Express your answer in terms of π.
Rosy, Suzy and Tabby shared the cost of a present which is $90. Rosy paid three times as much as Suzy. Tabby paid the same amount as Suzy. How much did Rosy pay for the present?
Denny paid $48 for a wallet during a sale. She was given a discount of $32. What percentage discount was given for the wallet?
A pail, filled with 3.7 litres of water is poured into the tank below. How much more water is needed to fill the tank?
Write 0.375 as a fraction in its simplest form.
Express 1 m² in square centimetres.
In 6.015, what is the place value of the digit 0?
Find the value of 6 + 18 ÷ 3 × 2 - 9.
Ahmad has $2 and Ben has $4. Which one of the following statements is incorrect?
options: 1) The ratio of Ahmad's money to Ben's money is 2:1.
2) The ratio of Ahmad's money to Ben's money is 1:2.
3) The ratio of Ben's money to Ahmad's money is 2:1.
4) The ratio of Ben's money to Ahmad's money is 4:2.
correct_answer_text: 1) The ratio of Ahmad's money to Ben's money is 2:1.

question: Express 108 minutes in hours.
Triangle ABC has base BC = 8 cm and height AD = 6 cm. What is the area of Triangle ABC?
Find the product of all the factors of 4.
In a rhombus, one angle is 46°. What is the value of the opposite angle?
Hela paid for an eraser that cost k cents with a two-dollar note. How much change did she receive?
A cube has 6 faces. Which of the following statements about the cube is incorrect?
Which one of the following would be the most likely height of the ceiling of your classroom?

In the figure, ACF is an equilateral triangle and BGED is a rectangle. Points A, C, F are vertices of the triangle. Points B, G, E, D are vertices of the rectangle. Which one of the following statements is true?
options: 1) All angles in triangle ACF are 60°
2) All angles in rectangle BGED are 90°
3) Triangle ACF has three equal sides
4) Rectangle BGED has four right angles
correct_answer_text: 1) All angles in triangle ACF are 60°

question: What is the value of the digit 8 in the number 248 671?
Which one of the following is larger than 3/5?
Ava, Ben and Chad have a total amount of $42. Which one of the following cannot be the ratio of the amount of money Ava has to the amount of money Ben has to the amount of money Chad has?
Which digit in 69.78 is in the tenths place?
Mei paid $2.50 for 50 stickers. How much did each sticker cost?
Points M, N, and P lie on a straight line. If MN = 8 cm and NP = 12 cm, which of the following is true?

Fann uses the recipe below to make biscuits. Recipe: Flour: 150g, Butter: 400g, Sugar: 100g. She has 300g of flour, 420g of butter and 110g of sugar. What is the greatest number of pieces of biscuit she can make?
There is a $2 discount for every purchase of 4 tickets. What is the percentage discount for the purchase of 10 tickets?
At a hawker centre, each table has either 3 or 5 chairs around it. The number of tables to the number of chairs is 7:25. What is the ratio of the number of tables with 5 chairs to that with 3 chairs?
What is the value of the digit '1' in 4 215 087?
Which of the following could be the total volume of liquid in 5 cans of drinks?
Mary, Nancy and Olivia shared 350 stickers in the ratio 3:2:5. How many stickers did Mary and Olivia have altogether?
15% of Jane's earnings is equal to 25% of Alicia's earnings. Jane earns $400 more than Alicia. How much does Jane earn?
Jamie is x years old. Sally's age is 3/4 of Jamie's age and 5 years older than Betty. How old is Betty?
The ratio of pens in box A to box B is 3:4. If there are 108 pens in box B, how many more pens were there in box B than in box A?
The average mass of 3 bags of rice is 10 kg. A fourth bag of rice weighing 6 kg is added to the total mass. What is the average mass of the 4 bags of rice now?
The table shows the charges for bicycle rental. First hour: $3.50, Each additional hour: $1.80. Dinesh rented 2 bicycles from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. How much did he pay?
1/4 of a bar is painted blue and 1/3 of the remaining bar is painted yellow. What fraction of the bar is painted?
What is the value of 3 hundreds, 4 tenths and 5 thousandths?
What is the value of 0.3 ÷ 6?

question: A rectangular field is 45 m long and 28 m wide. A path 2 m wide surrounds the field on the outside. What is the area of the path?

The figure is made up of a 20 cm by 14 cm rectangle and a semicircle on the shorter side. Find the area of the figure. Take π = 22/7.

A rectangle and a square have the same perimeter. The rectangle measures 26 cm by 8 cm. Find the area of the square.
correct_answer_text: Perimeter rectangle = 68 cm ⇒ side of square = 17 cm ⇒ area = 289 cm²

question: A square piece of paper of side 16 cm has a smaller square of side 6 cm cut out from each corner. What is the perimeter of the remaining shape?
The figure consists of a 15 cm by 10 cm rectangle with a quarter circle of radius 10 cm removed from one corner. Find the area of the remaining part. Take π = 22/7.
A circular garden has a diameter of 14 m. A rectangular path 2 m wide is built around it on the outside. Find the area of the path. Take π = 22/7.
The perimeter of a rectangle is 52 cm. If the length is 3 cm more than twice the width, find the area of the rectangle.
A rectangular plot 32 m by 24 m has a 3 m wide path built around it on the inside. Find the area of the path.
The figure is made up of a 18 cm by 12 cm rectangle with a semicircle of diameter 12 cm on one of the shorter sides. Find the total area. Take π = 22/7.
A rectangular room is 8 m long and 5.5 m wide. A square carpet of side 4.5 m is placed in the center. Find the area of the floor not covered by the carpet.
correct_answer_text: Floor area = 8×5.5 = 44 m², Carpet area = 4.5² = 20.25 m², Uncovered = 44 - 20.25 = 23.75 m²

question: A rectangular garden 25 m by 18 m has a circular pond of radius 4 m in one corner. The rest of the garden is covered with grass. Find the area covered by grass. Take π = 22/7.
correct_answer_text: Garden area = 25×18 = 450 m², Pond area = π×4² = 352/7 = 50.3 m², Grass area = 450 - 50.3 = 399.7 m²

question: The perimeter of an equilateral triangle is 42 cm. A square has the same perimeter as the triangle. Find the area of the square.
correct_answer_text: Square perimeter = 42 cm, side = 10.5 cm, area = 10.5² = 110.25 cm²

question: A composite figure consists of a 16 cm by 12 cm rectangle with a triangle of base 16 cm and height 8 cm attached to one of the longer sides. Find the total area of the figure.
correct_answer_text: Rectangle area = 16×12 = 192 cm², Triangle area = 1/2×16×8 = 64 cm², Total = 256 cm²

question: The area of a rectangle is 288 cm². If the length is 18 cm, find the perimeter of the rectangle.
